com.fasterxml.util.membuf
Class Segment

java.lang.Object
  com.fasterxml.util.membuf.Segment

public class Segment
extends Object

Container for individual segments that form physical storage level of the logical queue.

Author:
Tatu Saloranta

Field Detail

ABSOLUTE_MINIMUM_LENGTH

public static final int ABSOLUTE_MINIMUM_LENGTH
Let's not allow using segments shorter than 8 bytes; partly to ensure that length prefixes can not be split across more than one segments.

See Also:

Constructor Detail

Segment

public Segment(int size)
Method Detail

initForWriting

protected Segment initForWriting()
Method called when the segment becomes the active write segment.

This state transition must occur from Segment.State.FREE.

finishWriting

protected Segment finishWriting()
Method called when writes to this segment have been completed, which occurs when segment is full, more content is to be written, and another segment is becoming the active write-segment.

initForReading

protected Segment initForReading()
Method called when the segment becomes the active read segment. Its state may or may not change, but we do need to create the reader-wrapper for ByteBuffer

finishReading

protected Segment finishReading()
Method called when all contents has been read from this segment. Will return next segment and clear it.

Returns:
Next segment after this segment (before clearing link)

relink

public Segment relink(Segment next)

getNext

public Segment getNext()

availableForAppend

public int availableForAppend()
How many bytes can still fit within this segment?

availableForReading

public int availableForReading()

append

protected void append(byte[] src,
                      int offset,
                      int length)
Append operation that appends specified data; caller must ensure that it will actually fit (if it can't, it should instead call tryAppend(byte[], int, int)).

tryAppend

protected int tryAppend(byte[] src,
                        int offset,
                        int length)
Append operation that tries to append as much of input data as possible, and returns number of bytes that were copied

Returns:
Number of bytes actually appended

readLength

protected int readLength()
Method for reading as much of the length prefix as possible from the current pointer in this segment. This will be from 0 to 5 bytes, depending on length of prefix, and whether it resides completely in this segment or not.

readSplitLength

protected int readSplitLength(int partial)
Method that is called to read length prefix that is split across segment boundary. Due to

                    int length)

Returns:
Number of bytes actually read
